title: Waterfall plotting causes "IndexError: string index out of range" when some categorical values = "00", "0" or any "000.."
body:
Hi, 
So I have this dataset containing categorical values formatted like "00", "01", "02", etc.

I did not convert them to one hot encoding or anything since I use CatBoostRegressor, which supports this type of feature.

So, I have the following simple code:

  \# Train CatBoost with best params
  estimator = catboost_model.fit(inputs, labels)
  \# explain the model's predictions using SHAP
  explainer = shap.Explainer(estimator)
  shap_values = explainer(inputs)
  shap.plots.waterfall(shap_values[0])


It then throws:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File FILE_PATH, line 80, in <module>
    shap.plots.waterfall(shap_values[0], show=False)
  File FILE_PATH, line 122, in waterfall
    yticklabels[rng[i]] = format_value(features[order[i]], "%0.03f") + " = " + feature_names[order[i]] 
  File FILE_PATH, line 234, in format_value
    if s[0] == "-":
IndexError: string index out of range


From the source code, I understand that the error is coming from the formatting of the Y labels' tick values:

def format_value(s, format_str):
    """ Strips trailing zeros and uses a unicode minus sign.
    """

      if not issubclass(type(s), str):
        s = format_str % s
    s = re.sub(r'\.?0+$', '', s)
    if s[0] == "-":
        s = u"\u2212" + s[1:]
    return s

After the regex subtitution, my categorical value "00" becomes ""... which leads to the error at  if s[0] == "-".

Of course, I could adapt this value by mapping on all rows and converting "00" values to something else, but I feel like it could easily be supported.

Problem happens when format_value is called at line 122 of _waterfall.py file.

Thanks for having a look at it...
